intro: Galianthe peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian galianthe, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or mountainous terrain. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the flowers can be pink, red, or white, depending on the variety. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine by local communities.
